name: Pupil
description: Pupil is a bitboard based chess engine and AI written in Go. It was optimized for correctness and performance, passing initial perft tests up to depth 6 (over 100,000,000 positions) in under 5 seconds. The evaluation logic is pretty simplistic, but the engine is still quite strong.

name: Slim
description: Slim is a Slack imitation chat app built with Ruby on Rails, and React-Redux. Action Cable is used for live chat, updating channels' participation counts, and notifying users of new direct messages. There's also a chatbot named Slimbot, backed by Google's DialogFlow, which uses machine learning to interpret users' messages. Give it a try!

name: Minesweeper
description: This is a little minesweeper game built in React, featuring dynamic smiley faces indicating the game state. Press the face to reset the game. Hold alt down to put a flag down. The regular rules apply. Moving forward, I might make a variable square size depending on the size of the board. The big tiles for Hard mode seem a little too big, don't you think?

name: Narwhal Olympics
description: Narwhal Olympics is a library-free, vanilla JS browser game animated entirely with canvas and spritesheets. It features a custom physics engine to determine the narwhal's motion through space. Feel free to take the narwhal out for a spin. Watch out for the ocean bottom!

name: Penrose
description: An implementation of Penrose tiling, written using the p5.js library.

name: Stars
description: An interactive night-time skyscape, using p5.js.

name: Oscillator
description: Reconstructing a classic visual oscillator using the p5.js library.

name: Bugs problem
description: Little visualization of the classic four bugs problem tessellated on a plane.
